author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector S.Palanisamy has directed officials to clear encroachments from the new bus stand up to the Dargah area in Nagore immediately for ensuring smooth conduct of the kanthuri festival to be held from March 10 to 23.

He said that encroachments posed a hindrance for movement of devotees who will gather in large number. He advised the Revenue and police department officials to work in tandem to clear the encroachments on the streets in and around the New bus stand and also in the processional route of the Sandanakoodu.

He said the police would set up surveillance cameras at the administrative office of the Dargah. He advised the municipal authorities to ensure proper upkeep and maintenance of toilets.

Priority would be accorded for the supply of drinking water to the pilgrims, he added.

Abhinav Kumar, Superintendent of Police, C. Muthumari, Revenue Divisional Officer and Jayaraj, Revenue Divisional Officer were present.

Flag hoisting on March 10

In a release, S.A. Shaik Hassan Sahib, Nagore Dargajh Shariff Managing Committee, said that the ‘paimaram’ (kodimaram) hoisting ceremony – a preliminary ritual, would be held at 5. 55 a.m. on March 6 and the holy flag would be hoisted on March 10 marking the commencement of the ‘kanthuri’ festival.

He urged the government to sanction 40 kg of free sandalwood for the celebrations.

He urged the Union Ministry of Railway to operate special trains from Mumbai, Sengottai and Nagercoil from Nagore. A canteen should be opened at the Nagore railway station to cater to the needs of the pilgrims visiting Nagore during the kanthuri festival. He also wanted additional lights to be provided at the railway station at Nagore. New train service should be introduced between Nagore and Tirunelveli.
title: Stage set for Kanthuri festival
